channel.title: New local problems on FixMyStreet
channel.description: The latest local problems reported by users

item.title: 2 foot human excrement on the pavement outside 83 Nursery Road, 29th November
item.description:
As above. A monstrous human poo on the pavement outside my house. A fairly regular occurrence. I've had enough of cleaning these up myself. The six crackheads on the pavement outside my house were mortified and stating how disgusting they thought it is!!

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Nursery Road, Brixton, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Where indicated and nearby, 29th November
item.description:
A lot of leaves in Christchurch Avenue between Chatsworth Rd and Kilburn station, especially where indicated here; mostly on the pavement but also round the trees and in the roadside beside the kerb. Please pass on my gratitude to the sweeping team; thet are doing such a grand job Thank you

Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Christchurch Avenue, London

Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Fly tipping yourself by not collecting bins for weeks, 29th November
item.description:
You have not collected this recycling bin in weeks/months- you are also making it impossible to raise a ticket for missed bin collection and choosing to ignore the reports- you are therefore fly tipping your own borough, since the bin is overfilled and detritus are just on the floor. As bin collectors are coming weekly, they are very aware of it yet choosing to deliberately letting this problem worsen. Can’t even fathom why you’d decide to have a domestic recycling bin left in the middle of the street. Not its place.

Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Norman Road, Greenwich
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Cardboard boxes dumped / household bin, 29th November
item.description:
Yet again people just dumping their delivery boxes next to the bins Their addresses are clearly visible on the boxes yet Southwark Council do nothing to Stop this behaviour In addition, someone has bumped a domestic bin next to the green bins!!

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Trio Place, The Borough, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet
